headline: Ask HN: Ways for a RU sysadmin/DevOps to relocate to EU?
description:
Hello dear HN,

I understand that I'll probably get a lot of flak for this post, but bear with me.

I'm a Russian Linux admin in my 30s with 10+ years of various experience looking for a way to relocate into EU due to the obvious.

I have never supported this madness, have friends in Ukraine (who of us Russians doesn't?...) and have been mildly politically active since about 10 years ago (election observer, low-key pro-privacy activist).

My partner lives in Berlin and I'm currently residing in Yerevan, Armenia, still working for a RU company and trying to seek jobs in EU. Because of family matters, I can't apply for a partnership visa unfortunately. Also I'd hate to say that, and I know not all of you folks are easy with this but we're an LGBT couple.

Re: my work experience, I have good understanding of system internals and tools, but for example my Kubernetes knowledge is lacking at the moment (so I feel like an ancient relic already).

I'd be glad to hear any advice or opinions about what I should do in this situation. Many thanks guys, we should not let one madman and his clique ruin our world.
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 一个RU的系统管理员/开发工程师如何搬迁到欧盟？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 一個RU的系統管理員/開發工程師如何搬遷到歐盟？
description_zh-Hans:
你好，亲爱的HN，

我知道我可能会因为这个帖子而受到很多抨击，但请容忍我。

我是一个30多岁的俄罗斯Linux管理员，有10多年的各种经验，由于明显的原因，我正在寻找一种方法来重新安置到欧盟。

我从来没有支持这种疯狂，在乌克兰有朋友（我们俄罗斯人中谁没有？

我的伴侣住在柏林，我目前住在亚美尼亚的埃里温，仍在为一家俄罗斯公司工作，并试图在欧盟寻找工作。由于家庭事务，我不能申请伴侣签证，很遗憾。

关于我的工作经验，我对系统内部和工具有很好的理解，但例如我的Kubernetes知识目前还很缺乏（所以我觉得自己已经是个老古董了）。

我很高兴听到任何关于我在这种情况下应该怎么做的建议或意见。非常感谢各位，我们不应该让一个疯子和他的小团体毁了我们的世界。
